name: Red Fox
description: The red fox is Britain's most widespread wild carnivore. These clever animals are highly adaptable and can be found in forests, farmland, and even urban areas.
diet: Omnivore - rabbits, birds, insects, berries, and scraps
funFact: Foxes have excellent hearing and can locate prey under the snow!

name: European Badger
description: Badgers are nocturnal mammals known for their distinctive black and white striped face. They live in underground tunnel systems called setts.
diet: Omnivore - earthworms, insects, small mammals, fruits
funFact: A badger sett can be over 100 years old and have 50+ entrances!

name: Red Squirrel
description: The red squirrel is Britain's native squirrel species. They have beautiful reddish-brown fur and distinctive ear tufts.
funFact: Red squirrels can find buried nuts using their incredible sense of smell!

location.area: Scotland, Northern England, Wales, Isle of Wight

name: Hedgehog
description: The European hedgehog is a beloved British mammal covered in around 6,000 spines. They curl into a ball when threatened.
funFact: Hedgehogs can travel up to 2 miles in a single night searching for food!

name: Otter
description: The Eurasian otter is a semi-aquatic mammal that was once rare in Britain but has made a remarkable recovery thanks to conservation efforts.
funFact: Otters have the densest fur of any mammal - up to 1 million hairs per square inch!

name: Common Seal
description: Common seals, also called harbour seals, are found around British coasts. They have dog-like faces and spotted grey-brown coats.
funFact: Seals can hold their breath for up to 30 minutes underwater!

name: Red Deer
description: The red deer is Britain's largest land mammal. Male deer (stags) grow impressive antlers that can span over a metre.
funFact: A stag's antlers can grow up to 2.5cm per day - the fastest growing tissue in any mammal!

name: Puffin
description: Atlantic puffins are charismatic seabirds with colourful beaks. They nest in burrows on clifftops and are excellent swimmers.
funFact: Puffins can carry up to 60 fish in their beaks at once!

name: Barn Owl
description: The barn owl is a beautiful nocturnal bird with a heart-shaped face and silent flight. They are excellent hunters of small mammals.
funFact: Barn owls can locate prey in complete darkness using only their hearing!

name: Water Vole
description: The water vole, often called 'Ratty' from Wind in the Willows, is Britain's fastest declining mammal. Conservation efforts are vital.
funFact: Water voles dig extensive burrow systems with underwater entrances for safety!

name: Kingfisher
description: The kingfisher is one of Britain's most colourful birds with brilliant blue and orange plumage. They dive into water to catch fish.
funFact: Kingfishers can dive at speeds up to 25 mph to catch their prey!

name: Pine Marten
description: The pine marten is a cat-sized member of the weasel family. Once nearly extinct in Britain, they are slowly recovering in Scotland.
funFact: Pine martens are excellent climbers and can jump 4 metres between trees!
